absolutely we had a very bad Writers

pensive background I'm under the

nobody's ever prepared for that level of

South Carolina when a big hurricane is

and it certainly was was bigger than
anyone could have imagined there were
four feet of water in my little beach

it was a it was a very it was a very

my dad came around this time of year I

if he was coming all the way from the

talk to me but I'd better listen and he

we were all working people and we were

as a result of overwork during the

a baby boomers nightmare
I my office at the time of the terrorist

it was in the receiver of the telephone
it was in the carpet if you sat down on
a chair that clouds of dust would come

but it took a few months and so I was

exposure to about 150 hours of breathing
that contaminated air but I'm still here
and I'm still able to work and and offer

the overall healing that's needed right
now and here we are in the midst of

through you are now offering your

a way of thanking you for your service
if you're a veteran or first responder
the thing to remember is is I think two
months the first two months after a
disaster we see a huge rush of empathy
and one of my colleagues who's a
chaplain for the fire department was
telling me that they call this the
mission phase or the hero phase
and then after two to three months and
we see this now in the media
those stories kind of disappear and you
know that the cameras leave but people

young parents themselves that's been
particularly hard to watch the pediatric

hard for a doctor when they lose any
patient and so this is this is really a
humanitarian crisis on a whole different
level than what we've seen before in
your book the five gifts you come to
realize that if people are really going
to bounce back if they're going to show
resilience in the face of of this kind
of acute trauma the kind of trauma that
I've never had to experience in my life
and unfortunately I think most people
have never had to experience that there
are really some spiritual approaches I
would call them spiritual or
psychological perhaps that can make a
huge difference to people I was really
kind of desperate the first few months
after sandy I mean every day you're out
there with a knife in your teeth you
know trying to prevent yourself for
being financially cheated by you know
everybody from unscrupulous vendors to
insurance companies to the bank that
holds your mortgage and you're fighting
for every dollar and I was just
exhausted and so I asked myself what I
would do if I was my own client and you
know it's very hard to live your own
advice but what I would tell somebody is
to take 48 hours and turn off all media
and don't answer the phone and don't you
know answer any faxes and just just kind
of stay do whatever you want stay quiet
you know get a massage relax meditate
you know drink something soothing and
stay hydrated and so I gave myself that
48 hours and when I was meditating I was
asking whether this was it for the rest
of my life I mean am I going to be
embroiled in conflict with all of these
agencies forever and I was I was I was
told there was an inner voice that has
come to me before that whispered five
words and the five words are humility
patience empathy forgiveness and growth
and I was told to write them down and to
share them with people that these were
the five gifts that would help us get
through the long haul and so I've been
able to share these gifts were at the
time I was leading to long-term support

been able to share these five gifts with

after the shooting and I've also been

post-traumatic stress we're going to be

because that's that's what happens if we

or in overeating indulging in desserts

unfortunately that's been the experience

most people who you'll talk to who've
